In connection with the work of the Tropical Research Station of the New  York Zoological Society, conducted by Mr. William Beebe, collections of  insects, including bees, were made. The present report deals with a  series of bees from the Bartica District, and Mr. John Tee Van, in  forwarding them, states that "almost all of these bees were procured  about a clump of several species of nightshades (_Solanum_), which were  flowering in thinned-out jungle." I give an artificial key, which will  enable one who is not a specialist in bees to separate readily each  species from the rest. It will, of course, remain necessary to compare  any species with a fuller account to make sure that it is not some form  unrepresented in the present collection. The types of the new species  and varieties from British Guiana are deposited in The American Museum  of Natural History.
